title: Spearman's rank correlation coefficient
summary: In statistics, Spearman's rank correlation coefficient or Spearman's ρ, named after Charles Spearman and often denoted by the Greek letter ρ {\displaystyle \rho } (rho) or as r s {\displaystyle r_{s}} , is a nonparametric measure of rank correlation (statistical dependence between the rankings of two variables). It assesses how well the relationship between two variables can be described using a monotonic function.
